page.title: 07OUR SCHOOL
page.content: Our school was designed in 1849 because an epedemic in the area did not come to Wingfield. It opened 3 years later and cost Â£216 . Most of this was raised locally. More was added to it in 1953 to give it 2 classes, cloakroom, indoor lavatories, scullery and small library. Recently the County tried to close it but the parents made them change their mind. There are 54 children aged 5 to 11. Half live in the village. We have a secretary working 6 hours, a dinner lady 5hrs., a caretaker who also serves our dinners. Hot dinners are brought from another school.40 of us have sandwiches and we picnic under the apple trees in Summer.We have 2 fulltime teachers and one who comes in one day a week.I like games we pay to swim in Bradford. Lots of mums come to help with reading,cooking and sewing.
